page.title: 14WILD LIFE
page.content: The country side around Fetterangus is full of wildlife, but you need to know what to look for and must be very quiet. The river Ugie and Pitfour Lake influence the types of wildlife to be found. Beside the river is a breeding pair of otters living in a burrow in a ditch. The otters and black mink fish in the river. The mink may have escaped from a mink farm some miles away. I have seen roe deer and once found a newly born fawn. I did not touch it as its mother would have rejected it if it had traces of human smell. Wood-pigeons are common and their numbers make it easy to study the development of birds from the eggs to adults.
